title: S21_Pre
treatment_protocol_ch1: Plasma was defrosted on ice and centrifuged at 3,200 x g for 15 min at 4潞C to remove particulate matter. Pre-cleared plasma (250 碌l) was then mixed with an equal volume of thromboplastin D and incubated for 15 min at 37潞C. Supernatants were collected following centrifugation at 3,000 x g for 10 min at 4潞C, mixed with 100 碌l of ExoQuick (System Biosciences Palo Alto, CA, USA) and 6.25 碌l of RNAse (1 mg/ml), and incubated overnight at 4潞C. Exosomes were spun down at 1,500 x g for 25 min at 4潞C. Supernatants were then gently removed, and exosome pellets were resuspended in 50 碌l of PBS with 1.25 碌l of RNAse inhibitor (ThermoFisher Scientific, Waltham, MA, USA) and stored at -20潞C.
growth_protocol_ch1: Study participants performed an acute bout of aerobic exercise on a cycle ergometer as previously described (Distefano et al., 2018). Following a 6-min warm-up, participants cycled for 40 min at ~70% heart rate reserve, which was calculated during the maximum aerobic capacity test. Blood was drawn immediately after exercise (Post), and after 3 h of recovery (3h Post) via direct venipuncture using a 21-gauge butterfly needle, and blood samples were collected into K2-EDTA tubes PAXgene blood tubes (Becton-Dickson, Catalog #366643).
extract_protocol_ch1: For exosomal RNA isolation, 700 碌l of Qiazol (Qiagen, Germantown, MD, USA) were added to 50 碌l of exosome preparation, and the mixture was incubated for 5 min at room temperature. After the addition of 140 碌l of chloroform, the mixture was vortexed for 10 sec and incubated for 3 min at room temperature. After the upper aqueous phase was transferred to a fresh tube, a two-fold volume of absolute ethanol (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, US) was added, and the mixture was vortexed briefly. Samples were then transferred to RNeasy mini spin columns (Qiagen) that were centrifuged at 10,000 x g for 30 sec at 4潞C, and flow-through was discarded. An 80-碌l volume of DNase incubation mix was added directly onto the column membrane and samples were incubated for 15 min at room temperature. Following wash steps with RWT buffer, RPE buffer (Qiagen), and 85% ethanol, RNA pellets were dried by centrifugation at 10,000 x g for 1 min, and eluted in 15 碌l of water.
extract_protocol_ch1.1: Small RNA libraries were prepared from exosome-derived RNA using the NEB Next Small RNA Library Prep Set for Illumina (New England Biolabs, Ipswich, MA, USA), according to the manufacturer鈥檚 instructions. Briefly, RNA-Seq libraries were constructed using 2 ng of exosomal RNA and 15 cycles of PCR amplification. Libraries were run on a 6% TBE gel for 60 min at 120 V, and bands between 140 to 160 bp were excised from the gel using a razor blade. Gel pieces were crushed into smaller pieces and incubated in water overnight on a rotator. Libraries were isolated using gel filtration columns. Following ethanol precipitation, the resulting pellets were each resuspended in 11 碌l of ultrapure water. All libraries were analyzed on an Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer using the Agilent High Sensitivity DNA kit.
extract_protocol_ch1.2: Small RNA-Seq; for sequencing, libraries were pooled at equimolar concentrations, mixed with 5% PhiX (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA), and single-end sequencing was performed on an Illumina MiSeq platform following the manufacturer鈥檚 recommendations.
data_processing: Small RNA-seq reads were processed using the exceRpt pipeline (Rozowsky et al., 2019), as recommended by the ERC Consortium (https://exrna.org). The pipeline initially trims the reads using FASTX-Toolkit to remove remnants of the 3′-adapter sequence followed by removal of the reads of low-quality and homopolymer repeats, and subsequently aligns the trimmed reads to NCBI’s Univec database to filter out contaminants. The good reads were mapped to rRNA, and then to the human genome and transcriptome to obtain the counts of different gencode and RNA transcripts including miRNA and tRNA. The order of annotations is as follows: miRNAs (miRBase v21), tRNAs, piRNAs, gencode transcripts (hg38 Gencode v24; snRNAs, snoRNAs, miscRNAs, protein coding mRNAs, and lncRNAs), and circular RNAs. Mapping of the reads to the NCBI’s Univec database or rRNA or human genome/transcriptome was performed using STAR 2.4.2a (Dobin et al., 2013).
